passage:
(1) Ants are small insects that live together in groups called colonies. In an ant colony, every ant has a special job to do. Some ants look for food, some build the nest, and others take care of the baby ants. They all work together to help their colony live and grow.

(2) The queen ant is the most important ant in the colony. Her job is to lay eggs. Worker ants are female ants that cannot have babies. They do many jobs like finding food, building the nest, and protecting the colony from danger. Male ants have only one job - to mate with new queens.

(3) Ants use special chemicals called pheromones to talk to each other. When an ant finds food, it leaves a trail of these chemicals on the ground. Other ants can smell this trail and follow it to the food. Ants also use touches and movements to share information with other ants in their colony.

(4) Ants are very strong for their size. One ant can carry things that are 20 times heavier than its own body. When ants need to move something very heavy, they work together. Many ants will push and pull at the same time. This teamwork helps ants do big jobs even though they are very small animals.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?

options.A: There has been a good lesson yesterday.
options.D: There are seven colors in a rainbow.

questions.question: Which statement is grammatically correct?

options.A: Mount Everest is the widest mountain in the world.
options.B: The Nile River has been located in South America.
options.C: Australia is a smallest continent in the world.
options.D: The Sahara Desert will be in North America.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence.

options.A: I want to the park yesterday.

options.A: The book is in the shelf.
options.C: The cat is under the chair.
options.D: He is usually at home in Mondays.

options.C: He shouldn't work here no more.

options.A: My house is more big than yours.
options.B: She is taller than her sister.
options.C: This book is gooder than that one.
options.D: He runs more faster than me.

options.A: There is three books on the table.
options.B: There are a cat under the bed.
options.C: There is an apple in the bag.
options.D: There are one student in the class.

options.B: My mother and father is at home.
options.C: The book and the pen is on the desk.
options.D: Amihan and Malaya are friends of mine.

options.B: She were happy with her gift.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct adverb placement.

options.C: They happy play in the park.

According to paragraph 1, what is a colony?

options.C: A place where ants find food

What are worker ants?

options.C: Female ants that can have babies
options.D: Female ants that cannot have babies

questions.question: What is the only job of male ants?

options.A: To provide the colony with food
